review:
I have mixed feelings about this game. 

It's very atmospheric and fun to look at. The narrative is intriguing too. The world ironically makes me want to go backpacking and live in solice for a time. But then there is something evil lurking underneath the glamor. Degeneracy. 

When I began the game, I got the sense the main character was on a journey to heal himself from the pain of watching his marriage and wife decay due to her dimensia. But then the game insults this idea and the main character by pushing infidelity constantly. But maybe that is the point? 

While many people on the reviews I've seen don't like the conspiracy arc of the story, I was more interested and bothered by the game's push to get the main character to cheat on his sick wife. And in my opinion the conspiracy stuff was a red herring. Fluff to make the game seem more intruging than it really is. The true intent of the game is to see if you would selflishly cheat on your sick wife. Perhaps I pass the games test as the ending I chose was to keep the ring on the finger and keep the marriage intact but it was clear to me that the game really really wanted me to break those vows for your female partner on the radio that you speak to throughout the game. 60% of the dialogue choices leaned towards infidelity. 

This game is also something you wouldn't play more than once. Running is slow and there isn't much else to do after  playing it through once. In my opinion this game would have been much more successful as as movie than a videogame as it's mostly just walking around and looking at stuff. There is no real challenge. 

In conclusion I think this game is pointless. The red herring story is there just to keep you going but is ironically not as interesting as the story leads it up to being while the relationship that builds between the main character and the woman on the radio is designed solely to see if you are cuck enough to cheat on your wife. 

Don't play it. It's not worth $20. Buy a bottle of jack instead and share it with good friends.

review:
I thought it was a fairly decent game. Only if you wanted what you clearly expected from it. A walking simulator. But the issue that I have with this game is with the developer. Sean Vanaman abused the DMCA system and made a copyright strike against PewDiePie's Firewatch video. I'm not trying to defend what PDP said since I think it wasn't right to say what he did, and I am even someone who believes in free speech to the exstent of not caring what others think. But the issue has to do with whats right and whats wrong. You cannot make a video game, literally say it's ok to make money off that said game, then go back on your word because you disagree and take down another persons video. Sean wouldn't have reacted this way if a small time YouTuber said what PDP said, so what makes it right to do it to him? Its terrible. I truly thought the people at Campo Santo had great potential for making games even when people would shoot me down for saying I liked them. Unfortunatly, I can no longer support a game company that abuses a law put in place to protect people like themselves.

In short, at the time of this games release it seemed alright. But since the recent turn of events, I see virtue signaling from a corrupt game company. Firewatch is not worth $20.00 or even the lowest sale price Steam can give it. Do not buy this game.

It teases you all the way through making you think you're on to this big super important conspiracy event, which without spoiling it turns out to be probably the most stupid and convouluted thing you could imagine. Game in my mind is worth $5.00 no where near it's outragous $19.99 price tag. If you want a good walking simulator there are plenty of other fine ones out there with developers that are much more mature at handeling issues then this.

review:
Before I start I would like to say that the game is good, graphics are nice, storytelling is very immersive and the exploration is really enjoyable. Everything about this game is good except the point that i'm going to make and that makes me put a thumbs down on it.

This game is about the story, it got a moral and point of view wich it slowly leads you to, but it's hollow, it's not beatiful it's an empty shell, and it is this way because of the recent action of the co-creator of the studio developping this game, and since he is talking for the entirety of the studio, Santo Campo.
Santo Campo recently gave a strike to the most famous youtuber not because of copyright abuse but because of point of view about the youtuber's personality.

This action has several consequences :
1) It made them pubicly lied, they said community ( wich includes this youtuber ) could stream and make videos of their game and monetize them making them acting against the stance that this game took.
2) They advocate freedom of speech but actively try to censor a contenant creator because they considerate their point of view more important more true than other's. Making the point of this game seems a lot more... selfish, fake, untrue, hollow...
3) They made a game about trying to get your life back together and actively tries to destroy someone way of earning money and live, someone else's life. Wich goes against the point of this game yet again, wich makes everything i've seen and loved about this game a terrible LIE. I'm so disapointed. I loved the game so much.

I don't want any refund or anything, what I want back is my point of view, and my feeling of joy this game brought to me. But even the bigest update of steam cant refund me that now, can it ?

If you want something true in your life, and if you want the experience that the game brings to you to be real, to mean something, don't buy this game.
Or any other game from this company.

You will just end up being disapointed and depressed by the lack of genuine lessons of life those people could have bring you, but yet because they cant keep on their word, they just can't give that to you.

Their game has nothing for them left.

review:
There's a saying; "A pile of crap painted gold is still a pile of crap," and if there isn't a saying like that, there should be.

That's Firewatch in a nutshell: a pile of crap hiding behind bright colors, excellent voice work, and a good art style in a desparate attempt to distract from how empty and worthless it is. The characters are flat and unappealing and so lacking in endearing traits that it's almost depressingly easy to say, "I don't care what happens to these people." The soundtrack is bland and forgettable. What little story there is drags on and on to the point that continuing play is a chore. The most interesting moments are the first fifteen and the last ten minutes of play, before the startlingly abrupt ending, with everything in between being a long, drawn-out slog of nothing happening. No conflict, no character development, no interesting plot, no deeper mystery, NOTHING!

Save your money for something actually entertaining. Like porn or Shayamalan's The Village or a bucket of paint to throw on the wall and watch dry.
